title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics defeated the Chicago Bulls 124-105 before the All-Star break.
Nikola Vucevic scored 19 points with 11 rebounds, providing a strong performance from the bench.
Anfernee Simons expressed interest in returning to Boston, strengthening ties with teammates.

title: ‘Modern day concentration camp’: Irish man living in Boston area has been in ICE detention for 5 months
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Seamus Culleton, an Irish man in Boston, detained by ICE for 5 months due to a visa overstay.
Culleton, married to a U.S. citizen, describes harsh conditions in ICE detention, likening it to a modern concentration camp.
ICE rescinded Culleton's bail despite no notice of removal; DHS claims he voluntarily remains in detention.

title: Will Patriots move on from Stefon Diggs? Maye says WR has a lot ‘left in the tank’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs, despite a successful 2025 season, may become a cap casualty for the Patriots due to his $20.6 million salary.
Releasing Diggs before or after June 1 could save New England $16.8 million or $20.8 million in cap space respectively.
Diggs faces legal challenges with court dates for alleged assault and separate accusations linking him to business disputes.

title: Watch: Maynard police, fire crews save dog from ‘pet owner’s worst nightmare’
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Maynard police and fire departments rescued a dog from frigid waters after it fell through ice at Mill Pond.
A drone was used by police to assist firefighters in locating and rescuing the stranded dog, Rufus.
The dog was rescued within ten minutes and returned home without serious injuries, officials confirmed.

title: Signal issues cause multiple delays and cancellations on at least 6 commuter rail lines
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Commuter rail signal issues caused delays and cancellations on all 12 lines beginning Wednesday morning, some trains delayed up to 50 minutes.
More than 25 commuter rail trains were canceled on Wednesday, affecting services systemwide through the evening, according to the MBTA.
A Blue Line power issue prompted shuttle bus use between Orient Heights and Wonderland, but regular service resumed by Wednesday evening.

title: Former Worcester councilor found guilty of assault on police officer related to ICE arrest
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Etel Haxhiaj, former Worcester councilor, was found guilty of assaulting a police officer but acquitted of interfering charges.
Haxhiaj received six months probation and 40 hours of community service for the misdemeanor conviction.
Prosecutor emphasized Haxhiaj was charged for her conduct, not protest against ICE during the May 8 incident.

title: JetBlue lounge at Logan Airport will make its debut this summer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: JetBlue's new lounge, BlueHouse BOS, will open in Terminal C at Logan Airport near gate C23 this summer.
The Boston lounge will be 11,000 square feet, 40% larger than JFK's, with unique Boston-themed design and amenities.
Passengers will have access to complimentary food, beverages, and private workspaces with free WiFi at the new lounge.

title: ESPN predicts Patriots will target offensive lineman with 1st-round pick in 2026 NFL Draft
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: ESPN's Field Yates predicts the Patriots will draft Utah's Caleb Lomu, an offensive tackle, with their 2026 first-round pick.
The Patriots' offensive line struggled in Super Bowl LX, leading to six sacks and 11 quarterback hits against Drake Maye.
Despite left tackle Will Campbell's postseason struggles, Coach Mike Vrabel confirmed his position is secure for the future.

title: New Red Sox Caleb Durbin models his game after former Boston MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Caleb Durbin, a 5-foot-7 infielder, joins the Red Sox after a trade with the Brewers.
Durbin admires and models his game after former Red Sox second baseman Dustin Pedroia.
Durbin hit 11 home runs and had a .387 slugging percentage with Milwaukee in 2025.

title: Jaylen Brown offers Drake Maye advice on how to ‘level up’ after  championship heartbreak
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jaylen Brown advised Drake Maye to use his Super Bowl loss as motivation to improve.
Brown shared his own experience with championship losses and how they fueled his career success.
Brown expressed confidence in Maye's potential, suggesting he could have had an MVP season.
